metadata.name: Potential Unquoted Service Path Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects known WMI recon method to look for unquoted service paths using wmic. Often used by pentester and attacker enumeration scripts

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('wmic.exe') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\wmic.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' service get ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('name,displayname,pathname,startmode')))

output.summary: Detects known WMI recon method to look for unquoted service paths using wmic. Often used by pentester and attacker enumeration scripts
